instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: fin 820-3437 no backlight
threads.message:
backlight output on connector and screen side burned, connector replaced
wire ran q7707 pin4 to pin 6 (pad missing from pad 4)
wire ran from u7701 ball 5 to pin 1 c7797 (no continuity between u7701 and lcdbklt
0.858k ohms to ground at f7700, ppbus voltage 8.46
u7701 replaced 
150mv on lcdbklt 
testing done without screen, tested not working with screen

threads.title: fin 820-3437 no backlight
threads.message: Without screen there wil never be backlight voltage.....

threads.title: fin 820-3437 no backlight
threads.message: I know that, It tested the same with, if it helps voltage on l7701 pin1 is 0.2 volts and pin 2 is 170mv
